The EDPEnforcementLevel from Policy CSP should be used to enable and disable Windows Information Protection (formerly known as Enterprise Data Protection).

MSI/Policy.name: Policy
MSI/Policy.description: Policy nodes define the policy for launching executables, Windows Installer files, scripts, store apps, and DLL files. The contents of a given Policy node is precisely the XML format for a RuleCollection node in the corresponding AppLocker XML policy.

The EDPEnforcementLevel from Policy CSP should be used to enable and disable Windows Information Protection (formerly known as Enterprise Data Protection).

Script/Policy.name: Policy
Script/Policy.description: Policy nodes define the policy for launching executables, Windows Installer files, scripts, store apps, and DLL files. The contents of a given Policy node is precisely the XML format for a RuleCollection node in the corresponding AppLocker XML policy.

StoreApps.name: StoreApps
StoreApps.description: Defines restrictions for running apps from the Microsoft Store.

StoreApps/EnforcementMode.name: EnforcementMode
StoreApps/EnforcementMode.description: The EnforcementMode node for Windows Information Protection (formerly known as Enterprise Data Protection) does not affect the behavior of EnterpriseDataProtection. The EDPEnforcementLevel from Policy CSP should be used to enable and disable Windows Information Protection (formerly known as Enterprise Data Protection).

StoreApps/Policy.description: Policy nodes define the policy for launching executables, Windows Installer files, scripts, store apps, and DLL files. The contents of a given Policy node is precisely the XML format for a RuleCollection node in the corresponding AppLocker XML policy.

Different enrollments and contexts may use the same Authority identifier, even if many such identifiers are active at the same time.

EXE.description: Defines restrictions for launching executable applications.

EXE/Policy.description: Policy nodes define the policy for launching executables, Windows Installer files, scripts, store apps, and DLL files. The contents of a given Policy node is precisely the XML format for a RuleCollection node in the corresponding AppLocker XML policy.

StoreApps.name: StoreApps
StoreApps.description: Defines restrictions for running apps from the Microsoft Store.

StoreApps/Policy.description: Policy nodes define the policy for launching executables, Windows Installer files, scripts, store apps, and DLL files. The contents of a given Policy node is precisely the XML format for a RuleCollection node in the corresponding AppLocker XML policy.

StoreApps/Policy.name: Policy
StoreApps/Policy.description: Policy nodes define the policy for launching executables, Windows Installer files, scripts, store apps, and DLL files. The contents of a given Policy node is precisely the XML format for a RuleCollection node in the corresponding AppLocker XML policy.

./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/Configurati.name: Configuration
./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/Configurati.description: This node accepts an AssignedAccessConfiguration xml as input. Please check out samples and required xsd on MSDN.

./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/KioskModeAp.name: KioskModeApp
./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/KioskModeAp.description:
This node can accept and return json string which comprises of account name, and AUMID for Kiosk mode app.

Example: {"User":"domain\\user", "AUMID":"Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App"}. 

When configuring kiosk mode app, account name will be used to find the target user. Account name includes domain name and user name. Domain name can be optional if user name is unique across the system. For a local account, domain name should be machine name. When "Get" is executed on this node, domain name is always returned in the output.

This node supports Add, Delete, Replace and Get methods. When there's no configuration, "Get" and "Delete" methods fail. When there's already a configuration for kiosk mode app, "Add" method fails. The data pattern for "Add" and "Replace" is the same.

./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/ShellLaunch.name: ShellLauncher
./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/ShellLaunch.description: This node accepts a ShellLauncherConfiguration xml as input. Please check out samples and required xsd on MSDN.

./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/StatusConfi.name: StatusConfiguration
./Vendor/MSFT/AssignedAccess/StatusConfi.description: This node accepts a StatusConfiguration xml as input. Please check out samples and required xsd on MSDN.

./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/DeviceStateD.name: MdmConfiguration
./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/DeviceStateD.description: This node is to trigger snapping of the Device Management state data with "SNAP".

./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/EtwLog/Chann.title: ChannelName
./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/EtwLog/Chann.description: Each dynamic node represents a registered 'Channel' node. The node name must be a valid Windows event log channel name, e.g. "Microsoft-Client-Licensing-Platform%2FAdmin". When specifying the name in the LocURI, it must be url encoded or it'll be translated into a different URI unexpectedly.

Export.name: Export
Export.description: This node is to trigger exporting events into a log file from this node's associated Windows event channel. The log file's extension is .evtx, which is the standard extension of windows event channel log. The "Get" command returns the name of this node.

Filter.name: Filter
Filter.description: This node is used for setting or getting the xpath query string to filter the events when exporting the log file from the channel. Default value is empty string.

State.name: State
State.description: This node is used for setting or getting the 'Enabled' state of this node's associated windows event channel in the system. Setting it to "TRUE" enables the channel; setting it to "FALSE" disables the channel.

./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/EtwLog/Colle.title: CollectorName
./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/EtwLog/Colle.description: Each dynamic node represents a registered 'Collector' node. CSP will maintain an ETW trace session for this collector with its name used as a unique identifier. In a collector, a valid ETW provider can be registered and unregistered. The collector's associated trace session will enable the registered providers in it if the provider's state is 'Enabled'. Each provider's state, trace level and keywords can be controlled separately. The name of this node must not be a valid Windows event channel name. It can be a etw provider guid as long as it is not equal to an already registered 'Provider' node name.

LogFileSizeLimitMB.name: LogFileSizeLimitMB
LogFileSizeLimitMB.description: This node is used for setting or getting the trace log file size limit(in Megabytes) of this collector node's associated trace session. The value range is 1~2048. Default value is 4.

Providers/{ProviderGuid}.title: ProviderGuid
Providers/{ProviderGuid}.description: Each dynamic node represents an ETW provider registered in this collector node. The node name must be a valid provider GUID.

Keywords.name: Keywords
Keywords.description: This node is used for setting or getting the keywords of the event provider in this collector node's associated trace session. The string is in the form of hexadecimal digits and 16 chars wide. It'll be internally converted into ULONGLONG data type in the CSP. Default value is "0", which means all events from this provider are included. If the associated trace session is in progress, new keywords setting is applied immediately; if not, it'll be applied next time that session is started.

State.name: State
State.description: This node is used for setting or getting the state of the event provider in this collector node's associated trace session. If the trace session isn't started, changing the value controls whether to enable the provider or not when session is started; if trace session is already started, changing its value causes enabling or disabling the provider in the live trace session. Default value is true.

TraceLevel.name: TraceLevel
TraceLevel.description: This node is used for setting or getting the trace level of this event provider in this collector node's associated trace session. Default value is 5, which is TRACE_LEVEL_VERBOSE. If the associated trace session is in progress, new trace level setting is applied immediately;if not, it'll be applied next time that session is started.

1.description: TRACE_LEVEL_CRITICAL - Abnormal exit or termination events

3.description: TRACE_LEVEL_WARNING - Warning events such as allocation failures

4.description: TRACE_LEVEL_INFORMATION - Non-error events, such as entry or exit events

TraceControl.name: TraceControl
TraceControl.description: This node is to trigger "start" and "stop" of this collector node's associated trace session. "Get" returns the name of this node.

TraceLogFileMode.name: TraceLogFileMode
TraceLogFileMode.description: This node is used for setting or getting the trace log file mode of this collector node's associated trace session. The only two allowed values are 1 and 2, which are EVENT_TRACE_FILE_MODE_SEQUENTIAL and EVENT_TRACE_FILE_MODE_CIRCULAR. Default value is 1.

1.description: EVENT_TRACE_FILE_MODE_SEQUENTIAL-Writes events to a log file sequentially. It stops when the file reaches its maximum size.

2.description: EVENT_TRACE_FILE_MODE_CIRCULAR-Writes events to a log file. After the file reaches the maximum size, the oldest events are replaced with incoming events.

./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/Policy/Chann.title: ChannelName
./Vendor/MSFT/DiagnosticLog/Policy/Chann.description: Each dynamic node represents a registered 'Channel' node. The node name must be a valid Windows event log channel name, e.g. "Microsoft-Client-Licensing-Platform%2FAdmin". When specifying the name in the LocURI, it must be url encoded or it'll be translated into a different URI unexpectedly.

ActionWhenFull.name: ActionWhenFull
ActionWhenFull.description: Action to take when the log file reaches maximum size. "Truncate", "Overwrite", "Archive".

Enabled.name: Enabled
Enabled.description: This policy setting specifies whether the channel should be enabled or disabled. Set value to TRUE to enable and FALSE to disable.

MaximumFileSize.name: MaximumFileSize
MaximumFileSize.description: Maximum size of the channel log file in MB.

SDDL.name: SDDL
SDDL.description: SDDL String controlling access to the channel. Default: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/WES/eventmanifestschema-channeltype-complextype

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: AllowLocalIpsecPolicyMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. If this value is false, connection security rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced, regardless of the schema version and connection security rule version.   The merge law for this option is to always use the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: AllowLocalPolicyMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, firewall rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced.  The merge law for this option is to always use the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore. This value is valid for all schema versions.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: AuthAppsAllowUserPrefMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, authorized application firewall rules in the local store are ignored and not enforced.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: DefaultInboundAction
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is the action that the firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block]. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: DefaultOutboundAction
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is the action that the firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow]. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: DisableInboundNotifications
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. If this value is false, the firewall MAY display a notification to the user when an application is blocked from listening on a port. If this value is on, the firewall MUST NOT display such a notification.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: DisableStealthMode
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. When this option is false, the server operates in stealth mode. The firewall rules used to enforce stealth mode are implementation-specific. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: DisableStealthModeIpsecSecuredPacketExemption
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. This option is ignored if DisableStealthMode is on. Otherwise, when this option is true, the firewall's stealth mode rules MUST NOT prevent the host computer from responding to unsolicited network traffic if that traffic is secured by IPsec.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used. For schema versions 0x0200, 0x0201, and 0x020A, this value is invalid and MUST NOT be used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: DisableUnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcast
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If it is true, unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic is blocked.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: EnableFirewall
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is an on/off switch for the firewall and advanced security enforcement. If this value is false, the server MUST NOT block any network traffic, regardless of other policy settings.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: EnableLogDroppedPackets
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on, the firewall logs all the dropped packets. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: EnableLogIgnoredRules
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. The server MAY use this value in an implementation-specific way to control logging of events if a rule is not enforced for any reason. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: EnableLogSuccessConnections
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on, the firewall logs all successful inbound connections. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: GlobalPortsAllowUserPrefMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, global port firewall rules in the local store are ignored and not enforced. The setting only has meaning if it is set or enumerated in the Group Policy store or if it is enumerated from the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.  The merge law for this option is to let the value GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: LogFilePath
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is a string that represents a file path to the log where the firewall logs dropped packets and successful connections. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured, otherwise the MdmStore value wins if it is configured, otherwise the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: LogMaxFileSize
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value specifies the size, in kilobytes, of the log file where dropped packets and successful connections are logged. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured, otherwise the MdmStore value wins if it is configured, otherwise the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.name: Shielded
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DomainPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on and EnableFirewall is on, the server MUST block all incoming traffic regardless of other policy settings.  The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DynamicK.title: Id
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/DynamicK.description: A unique GUID string identifier for this dynamic keyword address.

Addresses.name: Addresses
Addresses.description:
Consists of one or more comma-delimited tokens specifying the addresses covered by this keyword. This value should not be set if AutoResolve is true.
                    Valid tokens include:
                    A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask not a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.
                    A valid IPv6 address.
                    An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
                    An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.

AutoResolve.name: AutoResolve
AutoResolve.description: If this flag is set to TRUE, then the 'keyword' field of this object is expected to be a fully qualified domain name, and the addresses will be automatically resolved. This flag should only be set if the Microsoft Defender Advanced Threat Protection Service is present.

Keyword.name: Keyword
Keyword.description: A String reprsenting keyword. If the AutoResolve value is true, this should be a Fully Qualified Domain name (wildcards accepted, for example "contoso.com" or "*.contoso.com"). If the AutoResolve value is false, then this can be any identifier string.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Firewall.title: FirewallRuleName
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Firewall.description: Unique alpha numeric identifier for the rule.  The rule name must not include a forward slash (/).

Action/Type.name: Type
Action/Type.description:
Specifies the action the rule enforces:
0 - Block
1 - Allow

App/FilePath.name: FilePath
App/FilePath.description: FilePath - This App/Id value represents the full file path of the app. For example, C:\Windows\System\Notepad.exe.

App/PackageFamilyName.name: PackageFamilyName
App/PackageFamilyName.description: PackageFamilyName - This App/Id value represents the PackageFamilyName of the app. The PackageFamilyName is the unique name of a Microsoft Store application.

App/ServiceName.name: ServiceName
App/ServiceName.description: This is a service name, and is used in cases when a service, not an application, must be sending or receiving traffic.

Description.name: Description
Description.description: Specifies the description of the rule.

Direction.name: Direction
Direction.description:
The rule is enabled based on the traffic direction as following.

IN - the rule applies to inbound traffic.
OUT - the rule applies to outbound traffic.

If not specified the detault is OUT.

EdgeTraversal.name: EdgeTraversal
EdgeTraversal.description:
Indicates whether edge traversal is enabled or disabled for this rule.

The EdgeTraversal property indicates that specific inbound traffic is allowed to tunnel through NATs and other edge devices using the Teredo tunneling technology. In order for this setting to work correctly, the application or service with the inbound firewall rule needs to support IPv6. The primary application of this setting allows listeners on the host to be globally addressable through a Teredo IPv6 address.

New rules have the EdgeTraversal property disabled by default.

Enabled.name: Enabled
Enabled.description:
Indicates whether the rule is enabled or disabled. If the rule must be enabled, this value must be set to true.
If not specified - a new rule is disabled by default.

IcmpTypesAndCodes.name: IcmpTypesAndCodes
IcmpTypesAndCodes.description:
String value. Multiple ICMP type+code pairs can be included in the string by separating each value with a ",". If more than one ICMP type+code pair is specified, the strings must be separated by a comma.
                    To specify all ICMP types and codes, use the "*" character. For specific ICMP types and codes, use the ":" to separate the type and code.
                    The following are valid examples: 3:4 or 1:*. The "*" character can be used to represent any code. The "*" character can't be used to specify any type, examples such as "*:4" or "*:*" are invalid.

                    When setting this field in a firewall rule, the protocol field must also be set, to either 1 (ICMP) or 58 (IPv6-ICMP).

InterfaceTypes.name: InterfaceTypes
InterfaceTypes.description:
String value. Multiple interface types can be included in the string by separating each value with a ",". Acceptable values are "RemoteAccess", "Wireless", "Lan", "MBB", and "All".
                    If more than one interface type is specified, the strings must be separated by a comma.

LocalAddressRanges.name: LocalAddressRanges
LocalAddressRanges.description:
Consists of one or more comma-delimited tokens specifying the local addresses covered by the rule. "*" is the default value.
Valid tokens include:
"*" indicates any local address. If present, this must be the only token included.

A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask not a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.
A valid IPv6 address.
An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.  If not specified the default is All.

LocalPortRanges.name: LocalPortRanges
LocalPortRanges.description:
Comma Separated list of ranges for eg. 100-120,200,300-320.  If not specified the default is All.
                    When setting this field in a firewall rule, the protocol field must also be set, to either 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP).

LocalUserAuthorizedList.name: LocalUserAuthorizedList
LocalUserAuthorizedList.description:
Specifies the list of authorized local users for the app container.
This is a string in Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) format..

Name.name: Name
Name.description: Specifies the friendly name of the firewall rule.

PolicyAppId.name: PolicyAppId
PolicyAppId.description: Specifies one WDAC tag. This is a string that can contain any alphanumeric character and any of the characters ":", "/", ".", and "_". A PolicyAppId and ServiceName cannot be specified in the same rule.

Profiles.name: Profiles
Profiles.description: Specifies the profiles to which the rule belongs: Domain, Private, Public.  See FW_PROFILE_TYPE for the bitmasks that are used to identify profile types.  If not specified, the default is All.

Protocol.name: Protocol
Protocol.description: 0-255 number representing the ip protocol (TCP = 6, UDP = 17).  If not specified the default is All.

RemoteAddressDynamicKeywords.name: RemoteAddressDynamicKeywords
RemoteAddressDynamicKeywords.description: Comma separated list of Dynamic Keyword Address Ids (GUID strings) specifying the remote addresses covered by the rule.

RemoteAddressRanges.name: RemoteAddressRanges
RemoteAddressRanges.description:
Consists of one or more comma-delimited tokens specifying the remote addresses covered by the rule. The default value is "*". Valid tokens include:
"*" indicates any remote address. If present, this must be the only token included.
"Defaultgateway"
"DHCP"
"DNS"
"WINS"
"Intranet"
"RemoteCorpNetwork"
"Internet"
"PlayToRenderers"
"LocalSubnet" indicates any local address on the local subnet. This token is not case-sensitive.
A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask not a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.
A valid IPv6 address.
An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.  If not specified the default is All.

RemotePortRanges.name: RemotePortRanges
RemotePortRanges.description:
Comma Separated list of ranges for eg. 100-120,200,300-320.  If not specified the default is All.
                    When setting this field in a firewall rule, the protocol field must also be set, to either 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP).

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/C.name: CRLcheck
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/C.description: This value specifies how certificate revocation list (CRL) verification is enforced. The value MUST be 0, 1, or 2. A value of 0 disables CRL checking. A value of 1 specifies that CRL checking is attempted and that certificate validation fails only if the certificate is revoked. Other failures that are encountered during CRL checking (such as the revocation URL being unreachable) do not cause certificate validation to fail. A value of 2 means that checking is required and that certificate validation fails if any error is encountered during CRL processing.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, use the local store value.

1.description: Specifies that CRL checking is attempted and that certificate validation fails only if the certificate is revoked. Other failures that are encountered during CRL checking (such as the revocation URL being unreachable) do not cause certificate validation to fail.

2.description: Means that checking is required and that certificate validation fails if any error is encountered during CRL processing

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/D.name: DisableStatefulFtp
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/D.description: This value is an on/off switch. If off, the firewall performs stateful File Transfer Protocol (FTP) filtering to allow secondary connections. FALSE means off; TRUE means on, so the stateful FTP is disabled. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/E.name: EnablePacketQueue
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/E.description: This value specifies how scaling for the software on the receive side is enabled for both the encrypted receive and clear text forward path for the IPsec tunnel gateway scenario. Use of this option also ensures that the packet order is preserved. The data type for this option value is a integer and is a combination of flags. A value of 0x00 indicates that all queuing is to be disabled. A value of 0x01 specifies that inbound encrypted packets are to be queued. A value of 0x02 specifies that packets are to be queued after decryption is performed for forwarding.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/I.name: IPsecExempt
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/I.description: This value configures IPsec exceptions and MUST be a combination of the valid flags that are defined in IPSEC_EXEMPT_VALUES; therefore, the maximum value MUST always be IPSEC_EXEMPT_MAX-1 for servers supporting a schema version of 0x0201 and IPSEC_EXEMPT_MAX_V2_0-1 for servers supporting a schema version of 0x0200. If the maximum value is exceeded when the method RRPC_FWSetGlobalConfig (Opnum 4) is called, the method returns ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER. This error code is returned if no other preceding error is discovered.   The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, use the local store value.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/O.name: OpportunisticallyMatchAuthSetPerKM
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/O.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. When this option is false, keying modules MUST ignore the entire authentication set if they do not support all of the authentication suites specified in the set. When this option is true, keying modules MUST ignore only the authentication suites that they don’t support. For schema versions 0x0200, 0x0201, and 0x020A, this value is invalid and MUST NOT be used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/P.name: PresharedKeyEncoding
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/P.description: Specifies the preshared key encoding that is used. MUST be a valid value from the PRESHARED_KEY_ENCODING_VALUES enumeration. Default is 1 [UTF-8].  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, use the local store value.

0.description: FW_GLOBAL_CONFIG_PRESHARED_KEY_ENCODING_NONE:  Preshared key is not encoded. Instead, it is kept in its wide-character format. This symbolic constant has a value of 0.

1.description: FW_GLOBAL_CONFIG_PRESHARED_KEY_ENCODING_UTF_8:  Encode the preshared key using UTF-8. This symbolic constant has a value of 1.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/S.name: SaIdleTime
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/Global/S.description: This value configures the security association idle time, in seconds. Security associations are deleted after network traffic is not seen for this specified period of time. The value MUST be in the range of 300 to 3,600 inclusive. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, use the local store value.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/HyperVFi.title: FirewallRuleName
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/HyperVFi.description: Unique alpha numeric identifier for the rule.  The rule name must not include a forward slash (/).

Action.name: Action
Action.description:
Specifies the action the rule enforces:
0 - Block
1 - Allow

Direction.name: Direction
Direction.description:
The rule is enabled based on the traffic direction as following.

IN - the rule applies to inbound traffic.
OUT - the rule applies to outbound traffic.

If not specified the detault is OUT.

Enabled.name: Enabled
Enabled.description:
Indicates whether the rule is enabled or disabled. If the rule must be enabled, this value must be set to true.
If not specified - a new rule is disabled by default.

LocalAddressRanges.name: LocalAddressRanges
LocalAddressRanges.description:
Consists of one or more comma-delimited tokens specifying the local addresses covered by the rule. "*" is the default value.
Valid tokens include:
"*" indicates any local address. If present, this must be the only token included.

A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask not a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.
A valid IPv6 address.
An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.  If not specified the default is All.

LocalPortRanges.name: LocalPortRanges
LocalPortRanges.description: Comma Separated list of ranges for eg. 100-120,200,300-320.  If not specified the default is All.

Name.name: Name
Name.description: Specifies the friendly name of the Hyper-V Firewall rule.

Priority.name: Priority
Priority.description: This value represents the order of rule enforcement. A lower priority rule is evaluated first. If not specified, block rules are evaluated before allow rules. If priority is configured, it is highly recommended to configure the value for ALL rules to ensure expected evaluation of rules.

Profiles.name: Profiles
Profiles.description: Specifies the profiles to which the rule belongs: Domain, Private, Public.  See FW_PROFILE_TYPE for the bitmasks that are used to identify profile types.  If not specified, the default is All.

Protocol.name: Protocol
Protocol.description: 0-255 number representing the ip protocol (TCP = 6, UDP = 17).  If not specified the default is All.

RemoteAddressRanges.name: RemoteAddressRanges
RemoteAddressRanges.description:
Consists of one or more comma-delimited tokens specifying the remote addresses covered by the rule. The default value is "*". Valid tokens include:
"*" indicates any remote address. If present, this must be the only token included.
A subnet can be specified using either the subnet mask or network prefix notation. If neither a subnet mask not a network prefix is specified, the subnet mask defaults to 255.255.255.255.
A valid IPv6 address.
An IPv4 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.
An IPv6 address range in the format of "start address - end address" with no spaces included.  If not specified the default is All.

RemotePortRanges.name: RemotePortRanges
RemotePortRanges.description: Comma Separated list of ranges for eg. 100-120,200,300-320.  If not specified the default is All.

VMCreatorId.name: VMCreatorId
VMCreatorId.description: This field specifies the VM Creator ID that this rule is applicable to. A NULL GUID will result in this rule applying to all VM creators.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/HyperVVM.title: VMCreatorId
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/HyperVVM.description: VM Creator ID that these settings apply to. Valid format is a GUID

AllowHostPolicyMerge.name: AllowHostPolicyMerge
AllowHostPolicyMerge.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is true, applicable host firewall rules and settings will be applied to Hyper-V Firewall.

DefaultInboundAction.name: DefaultInboundAction
DefaultInboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block]. This value controls the settings for all profiles. It is recommended to instead use the profile setting value under the profile subtree.

DefaultOutboundAction.name: DefaultOutboundAction
DefaultOutboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow]. This value controls the settings for all profiles. It is recommended to instead use the profile setting value under the profile subtree.

DomainProfile/AllowLocalPolicyMerge.name: AllowLocalPolicyMerge
DomainProfile/AllowLocalPolicyMerge.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, Hyper-V Firewall rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced.

DomainProfile/DefaultInboundAction.name: DefaultInboundAction
DomainProfile/DefaultInboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block].

DomainProfile/DefaultOutboundAction.name: DefaultOutboundAction
DomainProfile/DefaultOutboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow].

DomainProfile/EnableFirewall.name: EnableFirewall
DomainProfile/EnableFirewall.description: This value is an on/off switch for the Hyper-V Firewall enforcement.

EnableFirewall.name: EnableFirewall
EnableFirewall.description: This value is an on/off switch for the Hyper-V Firewall. This value controls the settings for all profiles. It is recommended to instead use the profile setting value under the profile subtree.

EnableLoopback.name: EnableLoopback
EnableLoopback.description: This value is an on/off switch for loopback traffic. This determines if this VM is able to send/receive loopback traffic to other VMs or the host.

PrivateProfile/AllowLocalPolicyMerge.name: AllowLocalPolicyMerge
PrivateProfile/AllowLocalPolicyMerge.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, Hyper-V Firewall rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced.

PrivateProfile/DefaultInboundAction.name: DefaultInboundAction
PrivateProfile/DefaultInboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block].

PrivateProfile/DefaultOutboundAction.name: DefaultOutboundAction
PrivateProfile/DefaultOutboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow].

PrivateProfile/EnableFirewall.name: EnableFirewall
PrivateProfile/EnableFirewall.description: This value is an on/off switch for the Hyper-V Firewall enforcement.

PublicProfile/AllowLocalPolicyMerge.name: AllowLocalPolicyMerge
PublicProfile/AllowLocalPolicyMerge.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, Hyper-V Firewall rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced.

PublicProfile/DefaultInboundAction.name: DefaultInboundAction
PublicProfile/DefaultInboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block].

PublicProfile/DefaultOutboundAction.name: DefaultOutboundAction
PublicProfile/DefaultOutboundAction.description: This value is the action that the Hyper-V Firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow].

PublicProfile/EnableFirewall.name: EnableFirewall
PublicProfile/EnableFirewall.description: This value is an on/off switch for the Hyper-V Firewall enforcement.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: AllowLocalIpsecPolicyMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is an on/off switch. If this value is false, connection security rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced, regardless of the schema version and connection security rule version.   The merge law for this option is to always use the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: AllowLocalPolicyMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, firewall rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced.  The merge law for this option is to always use the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore. This value is valid for all schema versions.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: AuthAppsAllowUserPrefMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, authorized application firewall rules in the local store are ignored and not enforced.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: DefaultInboundAction
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is the action that the firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block]. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: DefaultOutboundAction
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is the action that the firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow]. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: DisableInboundNotifications
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is an on/off switch. If this value is false, the firewall MAY display a notification to the user when an application is blocked from listening on a port. If this value is on, the firewall MUST NOT display such a notification.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: DisableStealthMode
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is an on/off switch. When this option is false, the server operates in stealth mode. The firewall rules used to enforce stealth mode are implementation-specific. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: DisableStealthModeIpsecSecuredPacketExemption
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is an on/off switch. This option is ignored if DisableStealthMode is on. Otherwise, when this option is true, the firewall's stealth mode rules MUST NOT prevent the host computer from responding to unsolicited network traffic if that traffic is secured by IPsec.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used. For schema versions 0x0200, 0x0201, and 0x020A, this value is invalid and MUST NOT be used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: DisableUnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcast
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If it is true, unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic is blocked.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: EnableFirewall
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is an on/off switch for the firewall and advanced security enforcement. If this value is false, the server MUST NOT block any network traffic, regardless of other policy settings.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: EnableLogDroppedPackets
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on, the firewall logs all the dropped packets. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: EnableLogIgnoredRules
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. The server MAY use this value in an implementation-specific way to control logging of events if a rule is not enforced for any reason. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: EnableLogSuccessConnections
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on, the firewall logs all successful inbound connections. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: GlobalPortsAllowUserPrefMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, global port firewall rules in the local store are ignored and not enforced. The setting only has meaning if it is set or enumerated in the Group Policy store or if it is enumerated from the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.  The merge law for this option is to let the value GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: LogFilePath
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is a string that represents a file path to the log where the firewall logs dropped packets and successful connections. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured, otherwise the MdmStore value wins if it is configured, otherwise the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: LogMaxFileSize
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value specifies the size, in kilobytes, of the log file where dropped packets and successful connections are logged. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured, otherwise the MdmStore value wins if it is configured, otherwise the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.name: Shielded
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PrivateP.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on and EnableFirewall is on, the server MUST block all incoming traffic regardless of other policy settings.  The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: AllowLocalIpsecPolicyMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. If this value is false, connection security rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced, regardless of the schema version and connection security rule version.   The merge law for this option is to always use the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: AllowLocalPolicyMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, firewall rules from the local store are ignored and not enforced.  The merge law for this option is to always use the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore. This value is valid for all schema versions.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: AuthAppsAllowUserPrefMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, authorized application firewall rules in the local store are ignored and not enforced.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: DefaultInboundAction
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is the action that the firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on inbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 1 [Block]. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: DefaultOutboundAction
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is the action that the firewall does by default (and evaluates at the very end) on outbound connections. The allow action is represented by 0x00000000; 0x00000001 represents a block action. Default value is 0 [Allow]. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: DisableInboundNotifications
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. If this value is false, the firewall MAY display a notification to the user when an application is blocked from listening on a port. If this value is on, the firewall MUST NOT display such a notification.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: DisableStealthMode
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. When this option is false, the server operates in stealth mode. The firewall rules used to enforce stealth mode are implementation-specific. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: DisableStealthModeIpsecSecuredPacketExemption
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is an on/off switch. This option is ignored if DisableStealthMode is on. Otherwise, when this option is true, the firewall's stealth mode rules MUST NOT prevent the host computer from responding to unsolicited network traffic if that traffic is secured by IPsec.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used. For schema versions 0x0200, 0x0201, and 0x020A, this value is invalid and MUST NOT be used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: DisableUnicastResponsesToMulticastBroadcast
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If it is true, unicast responses to multicast broadcast traffic is blocked.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: EnableFirewall
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is an on/off switch for the firewall and advanced security enforcement. If this value is false, the server MUST NOT block any network traffic, regardless of other policy settings.  The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: EnableLogDroppedPackets
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on, the firewall logs all the dropped packets. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: EnableLogIgnoredRules
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. The server MAY use this value in an implementation-specific way to control logging of events if a rule is not enforced for any reason. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: EnableLogSuccessConnections
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on, the firewall logs all successful inbound connections. The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: GlobalPortsAllowUserPrefMerge
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is false, global port firewall rules in the local store are ignored and not enforced. The setting only has meaning if it is set or enumerated in the Group Policy store or if it is enumerated from the GroupPolicyRSoPStore.  The merge law for this option is to let the value GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured; otherwise, the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: LogFilePath
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is a string that represents a file path to the log where the firewall logs dropped packets and successful connections. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured, otherwise the MdmStore value wins if it is configured, otherwise the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: LogMaxFileSize
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value specifies the size, in kilobytes, of the log file where dropped packets and successful connections are logged. The merge law for this option is to let the value of the GroupPolicyRSoPStore win if it is configured, otherwise the MdmStore value wins if it is configured, otherwise the local store value is used.

./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.name: Shielded
./Vendor/MSFT/Firewall/MdmStore/PublicPr.description: This value is used as an on/off switch. If this value is on and EnableFirewall is on, the server MUST block all incoming traffic regardless of other policy settings.  The merge law for this option is to let "on" values win.

./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/ForceRet.name: ForceRetrieve
./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/ForceRet.description: Instructs the client to initiate a new request to DHA-Service, and get a new DHA-EncBlob (a summary of the boot state that is issued by DHA-Service). This option should only be used if the MDM server enforces a certificate freshness policy, which needs to force a device to get a fresh encrypted blob from DHA-Service.

./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/HASEndpo.name: HASEndpoint
./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/HASEndpo.description: Identifies the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the DHA-Service that is assigned to perform attestation. If an FQDN is not assigned, DHA-Cloud (Microsoft owned and operated cloud service) will be used as the default attestation service.

./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/Nonce.name: Nonce
./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/Nonce.description: Enables MDMs to protect the device health attestation communications from man-in-the-middle type (MITM) attacks with a crypt-protected random value that is generated by the MDM Server. The nonce is in hex format, with a minimum size of 8 bytes, and a maximum size of 32 bytes.

./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/Preferre.name: PreferredMaxProtocolVersion
./Vendor/MSFT/HealthAttestation/Preferre.description: Provides the maximum preferred protocol version that the client is configured to communicate over. If this is higher than the protocol versions supported by the client it will use the highest protocol version available to it.

./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/AutoDetect.name: AutoDetect
./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/AutoDetect.description: Automatically detect settings. If enabled, the system tries to find the path to a PAC script.

./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/ProxyServer/E.name: Exceptions
./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/ProxyServer/E.description: Addresses that should not use the proxy server. The system will not use the proxy server for addresses beginning with what is specified in this node. Use semicolons (;) to separate entries.

./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/ProxyServer/U.name: UseProxyForLocalAddresses
./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/ProxyServer/U.description: Specifies whether the proxy server should be used for local (intranet) addresses.  Valid values:

0.description: Use proxy server for local addresses

1.description: Do not use proxy server for local addresses

./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/ProxySettings.name: ProxySettingsPerUser
./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/ProxySettings.description: When set to 0, it enables proxy configuration as global, machine wide.

0.description: Proxy configuration is global, machine wide.

./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/SetupScriptUr.name: SetupScriptUrl
./Vendor/MSFT/NetworkProxy/SetupScriptUr.description: Address to the PAC script you want to use.

./Vendor/MSFT/Personalization.name: Personalization
./Vendor/MSFT/Personalization.description: Configure a PC's personalization settings such as Desktop Image and Lock Screen Image.

./Vendor/MSFT/Personalization/DesktopIma.name: DesktopImageUrl
./Vendor/MSFT/Personalization/DesktopIma.description: A http or https Url to a jpg, jpeg or png image that needs to be downloaded and used as the Desktop Image or a file Url to a local image on the file system that needs to be used as the Desktop Image.

./Vendor/MSFT/Personalization/LockScreen.name: LockScreenImageUrl
./Vendor/MSFT/Personalization/LockScreen.description: A http or https Url to a jpg, jpeg or png image that neeeds to be downloaded and used as the Lock Screen Image or a file Url to a local image on the file system that needs to be used as the Lock Screen Image.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL.name: SUPL
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL.description: Defines the account for the SUPL Enabled Terminal (SET) node. Only one SUPL account is supported at a given time.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Addr.name: Addr
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Addr.description: Optional. Specifies the address of the Home SUPL Location Platform (H-SLP) server for non-proxy mode. The value is a server address specified as a fully qualified domain name, and the port specified as an integer, with the format server: port.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/F.name: FullVersion
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/F.description: Optional. Determines the full version (X.Y.Z where X, Y and Z are major version, minor version, service indicator, respectively) of the SUPL protocol to use. The default is 1.0.0. If FullVersion is defined, Version field is ignored

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/H.name: HighAccPositioningMethod
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/H.description: Optional. Specifies the positioning method that the SUPL client will use for mobile originated position requests. The default is 0. The default method in Windows provides high-quality assisted GNSS positioning for mobile originated position requests without loading the mobile operator's network or location services. For OMA DM, if the format for this node is incorrect the entry will be ignored and an error will be returned, but the configuration service provider will continue processing the rest of the parameters.

0.description: None: The device uses the default positioning method. In this default mode, the GNSS obtains assistance (time injection, coarse position injection and ephemeris data) from the Microsoft Positioning Service.

1.description: Mobile Station Assisted: The device contacts the H-SLP server to obtain a position. The H-SLP does the calculation of the position and returns it to the device.

2.description: Mobile Station Based: The device obtains location-aiding data (almanac, ephemeris data, time and coarse initial position of the device) from the H-SLP server, and the device uses this information to help GPS obtain a fix. All position calculations are done in the device.

3.description: Mobile Station Standalone: The device obtains assistance as required from the Microsoft location services.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/L.name: LocMasterSwitchDependencyNII
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/L.description: This setting is deprecated in Windows 10. Optional. Boolean. Specifies whether the location toggle on the location screen in Settings is also used to manage SUPL network-initiated (NI) requests for location. If the value is set to 0, the NI behavior is independent from the current location toggle setting. If the value is set to 1, the NI behavior follows the current location toggle setting. The default value is 1. Note that most clients do not support this behavior. This value manages the settings for both SUPL and v2 UPL. If a phone is configured for both SUPL and V2 UPL and these values differ, the SUPL setting will always be used.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/M.name: MCCMNCPairs
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/M.description: Required. List all of the MCC and MNC pairs owned by the mobile operator. This list is used to verify that the UICC matches the network and SUPL can be used. When the UICC and network do not match, the phone uses the default location service and does not use SUPL.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/N.name: NIDefaultTimeout
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/N.description: Optional. Time in seconds that the network-initiated location request is displayed to the user, while awaiting a response and before doing the default action. The default is 30 seconds. A value between 20 and 60 seconds is recommended.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Data
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: The base 64 encoded blob of the H-SLP root certificate.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Name
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: Specifies the name of the H-SLP root certificate as a string, in the format name.cer.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Data
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: The base 64 encoded blob of the H-SLP root certificate.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Name
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: Specifies the name of the H-SLP root certificate as a string, in the format name.cer.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Data
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: The base 64 encoded blob of the H-SLP root certificate.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Name
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: Specifies the name of the H-SLP root certificate as a string, in the format name.cer.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Data
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: The base 64 encoded blob of the H-SLP root certificate.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Name
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: Specifies the name of the H-SLP root certificate as a string, in the format name.cer.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Data
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: The base 64 encoded blob of the H-SLP root certificate.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Name
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: Specifies the name of the H-SLP root certificate as a string, in the format name.cer.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Data
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: The base 64 encoded blob of the H-SLP root certificate.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.name: Name
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/R.description: Specifies the name of the H-SLP root certificate as a string, in the format name.cer.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/S.name: ServerAccessInterval
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/S.description: Optional. Integer. Defines the minimum interval of time in seconds between mobile originated requests sent to the server to prevent overloading the mobile operator's network. The default value is 60.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/V.name: Version
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/SUPL1/Ext/Microsoft/V.description: Optional. Determines the major version of the SUPL protocol to use. For SUPL 1.0.0, set this value to 1. For SUPL 2.0.0, set this value to 2. The default is 1. Refer to FullVersion to define minor verison and service indicator

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /LocMasterSwit.name: LocMasterSwitchDependencyNII
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /LocMasterSwit.description: Optional. Boolean. Specifies whether the location toggle on the location screen in Settings is also used to manage network-initiated requests for location. If the value is set to 0, the NI behavior is independent from the current location toggle setting. If the value is set to 1, the NI behavior follows the current location toggle setting. For CDMA phones, this value must be set to 1. The default value is 1.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /MPC.name: MPC
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /MPC.description: Optional. The address of the mobile positioning center (MPC), in the format ipAddress: portNumber. For non-trusted mode of operation, this parameter is mandatory and the PDE parameter must be empty.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /NIDefaultTime.name: NIDefaultTimeout
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /NIDefaultTime.description: Optional. Time in seconds that the network-initiated location request is displayed to the user, while awaiting a response and before doing the default action. The default is 30 seconds. A value between 20 and 60 seconds is recommended.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /PDE.name: PDE
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /PDE.description: Optional. The address of the Position Determination Entity (PDE), in the format ipAddress: portNumber. For non-trusted mode of operation, this parameter must be empty.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /PositioningMe.name: PositioningMethod_MR
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /PositioningMe.description: Optional. Specifies the positioning method that the SUPL client will use for mobile originated position requests. The default is 0. The default method in Windows provides high-quality assisted GNSS positioning for mobile originated position requests without loading the mobile operator's network or location services. The Mobile Station Assisted and AFLT positioning methods must only be configured for test purposes. For OMA DM, if the format for this node is incorrect the entry will be ignored and an error will be returned, but the configuration service provider will continue processing the rest of the parameters.

0.description: None: The device uses the default positioning method. In this default mode, the GNSS obtains assistance (time injection, coarse position injection, and ephemeris data) from the Microsoft Positioning Service.

1.description: Mobile Station Assisted: The device contacts the H-SLP server to obtain a position. The H-SLP does the calculation of the position and returns it to the device.

2.description: Mobile Station Based: The device obtains location-aiding data (almanac, ephemeris data, time and coarse initial position of the device) from the H-SLP server, and the device uses this information to help GPS obtain a fix. All position calculations are done in the device.

3.description: Mobile Station Standalone: The device obtains assistance as required from the Microsoft location services.

./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /ServerAccessI.name: ServerAccessInterval
./Vendor/MSFT/SUPL/V2UPL1 /ServerAccessI.description: Optional. Integer. Defines the minimum interval of time in seconds between mobile originated requests sent to the server to prevent overloading the mobile operator's network. The default value is 60.

./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/AllowScre.name: AllowScreenMonitoring
./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/AllowScre.description: Indicates if screen monitoring is allowed by the app.

./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/AllowText.name: AllowTextSuggestions
./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/AllowText.description: Indicates if keyboard text suggestions are allowed by the app.

0.description: Keyboard text suggestions are not allowed

./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/Assessmen.name: Assessments
./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/Assessmen.description: Enables support for multiple assessments and for assessment grouping. The structure is specified by an XML.

./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/LaunchURI.name: LaunchURI
./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/LaunchURI.description: Link to an assessment that's automatically loaded when the Secure Assessment Browser is launched.

./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/RequirePr.name: RequirePrinting
./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/RequirePr.description: Indicates if printing is required by the app.

./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/TesterAcc.name: TesterAccount
./Vendor/MSFT/SecureAssessment/TesterAcc.description: The user name of the test taking account.  To specify a domain account, use domain\user. To specify an AAD account, use username@tenant.com. To specify a local account, use the username.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/AccountModel.name: AccountModel
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/AccountModel.title: Account model
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/AccountModel.description: Configures which type of accounts are allowed to use the PC. Allowed values: 0 (only guest), 1 (domain-joined only), 2 (domain-joined and guest). If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

2.description: Domain-joined and guest accounts are allowed.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DeletionPolicy.name: DeletionPolicy
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DeletionPolicy.title: Account deletion policy
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DeletionPolicy.description: Configures when accounts will be deleted. Allowed values: 0 (delete immediately), 1 (delete at disk space threshold), 2 (Delete at disk space threshold and inactive threshold). If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

2.description: Delete at disk space threshold and inactive threshold

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DiskLevelCaching.name: DiskLevelCaching
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DiskLevelCaching.title: Disk space threshold for account caching
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DiskLevelCaching.description: Stop deleting accounts when available disk space reaches this threshold, given as percent of total disk capacity. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DiskLevelDeletion.name: DiskLevelDeletion
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DiskLevelDeletion.title: Disk space threshold for account deletion
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/DiskLevelDeletion.description: Accounts will start being deleted when available disk space falls below this threshold, given as percent of total disk capacity. Accounts that have been inactive the longest will be deleted first. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableAccountMana.name: EnableAccountManager
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableAccountMana.title: Enable account manager
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableAccountMana.description: Enable the account manager for shared PC mode. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableSharedPCMod.name: EnableSharedPCMode
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableSharedPCMod.title: Enable shared PC mode
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableSharedPCMod.description: Setting this node to "true" triggers the action to configure a device to Shared PC mode.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableSharedPCMod.name: EnableSharedPCModeWithOneDriveSync
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableSharedPCMod.title: Enable Shared PC mode with OneDrive sync
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableSharedPCMod.description: Setting this node to “1” triggers the action to configure a device to Shared PC mode with OneDrive sync turned on

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableWindowsInsi.name: EnableWindowsInsiderPreviewFlighting
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableWindowsInsi.title: Enable WIP Flighting
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/EnableWindowsInsi.description: Setting this node to “1” enables Windows Insider Preview flighting and the ability to receive insider preview builds.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/InactiveThreshold.name: InactiveThreshold
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/InactiveThreshold.title: Account inactive threshold
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/InactiveThreshold.description: Accounts will start being deleted when they have not been logged on during the specified period, given as number of days.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/KioskModeAUMID.name: KioskModeAUMID
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/KioskModeAUMID.title: Kiosk mode AUMID
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/KioskModeAUMID.description: Specifies the AUMID of the app to use with assigned access. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/KioskModeUserTile.name: KioskModeUserTileDisplayText
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/KioskModeUserTile.title: Kiosk mode user tile display text
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/KioskModeUserTile.description: Specifies the display text for the account shown on the sign-in screen which launches the app specified by KioskModeAUMID. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/MaintenanceStartT.name: MaintenanceStartTime
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/MaintenanceStartT.title: Maintenance start time
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/MaintenanceStartT.description: Daily start time of maintenance hour. Given in minutes from midnight. Default is 0 (12am).  If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/MaxPageFileSizeMB.name: MaxPageFileSizeMB
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/MaxPageFileSizeMB.title: Maximum PageFile size
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/MaxPageFileSizeMB.description: Maximum size of the paging file in MB. Applies only to systems with less than 32 GB storage and at least 3 GB of RAM. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/RestrictLocalStor.name: RestrictLocalStorage
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/RestrictLocalStor.title: Restrict local storage
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/RestrictLocalStor.description: Restricts the user from using local storage. This node is optional. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SetEduPolicies.name: SetEduPolicies
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SetEduPolicies.title: Set EDU policies
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SetEduPolicies.description: Set a list of EDU policies.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SetPowerPolicies.name: SetPowerPolicies
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SetPowerPolicies.title: Set power policies
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SetPowerPolicies.description: Set a list of power policies. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SignInOnResume.name: SignInOnResume
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SignInOnResume.title: Sign-in on resume
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SignInOnResume.description: Require signing in on waking up from sleep. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SleepTimeout.name: SleepTimeout
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SleepTimeout.title: Sleep timeout
./Vendor/MSFT/SharedPC/SleepTimeout.description: The amount of time before the PC sleeps, giving in seconds. 0 means the PC never sleeps. Default is 5 minutes. If used, this value must be set before the action on the EnableSharedPCMode node is taken.

./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/DeviceLic.name: LicenseType
./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/DeviceLic.description: License Type: User Based Subscription or Device Based Subscription

./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/SMode/Swi.name: SwitchingPolicy
./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/SMode/Swi.description: Policy that determines whether a consumer can switch the device out of S mode

0.description: No Restriction: The user is allowed to switch the device out of S mode.

1.description: User Blocked: The admin has blocked the user from switching their device out of S mode. Only the admin can switch the device out of S mode through the SMode/SwitchFromSMode node.

./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/Subscript.name: DisableSubscription
./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/Subscript.description: Disable or Enable subscription activation on a device

1.description: Disable Subscription. It also removes any existing subscription on the device.

./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/Subscript.name: SubscriptionType
./Vendor/MSFT/WindowsLicensing/Subscript.description: Set device to Device Based Subscription or User Based Subscription. For Device Based Subscription this action will automatically acquire the subscription on the device. For User Based Subscription the existing process of user logon will be required.
